title.text: RFC 4546: Radio Frequency (RF) Interface Management Information Base for Data over Cable Service Interface Specifications (DOCSIS) 2.0 Compliant RF Interfaces

contents.text:
Network Working Group                                          D. Raftus
Request for Comments: 4546                        ATI Technologies, Inc.
Obsoletes: 2670                                               E. Cardona
Category: Standards Track                                      CableLabs
                                                               June 2006
Radio Frequency (RF) Interface Management Information Base for Data over Cable Service Interface Specifications (DOCSIS) 2.0 Compliant RF Interfaces
contents.zh-CHS: 电缆数据服务接口规范（DOCSIS）2.0兼容射频接口的射频（RF）接口管理信息库

contents.text: Status of This Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 关于下段备忘

contents.text: This document specifies an Internet standards track protocol for the Internet community, and requests discussion and suggestions for improvements. Please refer to the current edition of the "Internet Official Protocol Standards" (STD 1) for the standardization state and status of this protocol. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件规定了互联网社区的互联网标准跟踪协议，并要求进行讨论和提出改进建议。有关本协议的标准化状态和状态，请参考当前版本的“互联网官方协议标准”（STD 1）。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.text: This document revises and obsoletes RFC 2670. Please see Section 5.3 for a description of the changes from RFC 2670.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件修订并废除RFC 2670。有关RFC 2670变更的说明，请参见第5.3节。

contents.text: Copyright Notice
contents.zh-CHS: 版权公告

contents.text: Copyright (C) The Internet Society (2006).
contents.zh-CHS: 版权所有（C）互联网协会（2006年）。

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: This memo defines a portion of the Management Information Base (MIB) for use with network management protocols in the Internet community. In particular, it defines a set of managed objects for Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) based management of the Radio Frequency (RF) interfaces for systems compliant with the Data Over Cable Service Interface Specifications (DOCSIS).
contents.zh-CHS: 此备忘录定义了管理信息库（MIB）的一部分，用于Internet社区中的网络管理协议。特别是，它定义了一组管理对象，用于基于简单网络管理协议（SNMP）的射频（RF）接口管理，用于符合电缆数据服务接口规范（DOCSI）的系统。

contents.text: Table of Contents
contents.zh-CHS: 目录

contents.text: 1. The Internet-Standard Management Framework
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 因特网标准管理框架

contents.text: For a detailed overview of the documents that describe the current Internet-Standard Management Framework, please refer to section 7 of RFC 3410 [RFC3410].
contents.zh-CHS: 有关描述当前互联网标准管理框架的文件的详细概述，请参阅RFC 3410[RFC3410]第7节。

contents.text: Managed objects are accessed via a virtual information store, termed the Management Information Base or MIB. MIB objects are generally accessed through the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP). Objects in the MIB are defined using the mechanisms defined in the Structure of Management Information (SMI). This memo specifies a MIB module that is compliant to the SMIv2, which is described in STD 58, RFC 2578 [RFC2578], STD 58, RFC 2579 [RFC2579] STD 58, RFC 2580 [RFC2580].
contents.zh-CHS: 托管对象通过虚拟信息存储（称为管理信息库或MIB）进行访问。MIB对象通常通过简单网络管理协议（SNMP）进行访问。MIB中的对象是使用管理信息结构（SMI）中定义的机制定义的。本备忘录规定了符合SMIv2的MIB模块，如STD 58、RFC 2578[RFC2578]、STD 58、RFC 2579[RFC2579]STD 58、RFC 2580[RFC2580]所述。

contents.text: 2. Glossary
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 术语汇编

contents.text: The terms in this document are derived either from normal cable system usage, or from the documents associated with the Data Over Cable Service Interface Specification process.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档中的术语来源于正常的有线电视系统使用，或与有线电视数据服务接口规范流程相关的文档。

contents.text: 2.1. Baseline Privacy
contents.zh-CHS: 2.1. 基线隐私

contents.text: Security interface specification, designed for DOCSIS-compliant cable data systems, that ensures device authentication data confidentiality in the CATV plant. See [BPI] and [BPIPLUS].
contents.zh-CHS: 安全接口规范，专为符合DOCSIS标准的电缆数据系统设计，确保CATV设备中设备认证数据的机密性。参见[BPI]和[BPIPLUS]。

contents.text: 2.2. CATV
contents.zh-CHS: 2.2. 有线电视

contents.text: Originally "Community Antenna Television", it now refers to any cable or hybrid fiber and cable system used to deliver video signals to a community.
contents.zh-CHS: 它最初是“社区天线电视”，现在指的是用于向社区传送视频信号的任何有线或混合光纤和有线系统。

contents.text: 2.3. Channel

A specific frequency allocation with an RF medium, specified by channel width in Hertz (cycles per second) and by center frequency. Within the US Cable Systems, upstream channels are generally allocated from the 5-42MHz range while downstream channels are generally allocated from the 50-750MHz range, depending on the capabilities of the given system. The typical broadcast channel width in the US is 6MHz. Upstream channel widths for DOCSIS vary.
contents.zh-CHS: 射频介质的一种特定频率分配，由信道宽度（赫兹）（每秒周期数）和中心频率指定。在美国电缆系统中，上游信道通常从5-42MHz范围分配，而下游信道通常从50-750MHz范围分配，具体取决于给定系统的能力。美国的典型广播频道宽度为6MHz。DOCSI的上游河道宽度各不相同。

contents.text: For European cable systems, upstream channels vary by country. The upper edge of upstream channel allocations varies between 25 MHz to 65 MHz, and the lower edge of downstream channel allocations varies between 47 MHz and 87.5 MHz. The typical broadcast channel width in Europe is 8MHz. The actual parameters are of concern to systems deploying Euro-DOCSIS technology.
contents.zh-CHS: 对于欧洲电缆系统，上游通道因国家而异。上行信道分配的上边缘在25 MHz到65 MHz之间变化，而下行信道分配的下边缘在47 MHz到87.5 MHz之间变化。欧洲的典型广播频道宽度为8MHz。实际参数与采用Euro DOCSIS技术的系统有关。

contents.text: The downstream channels conform to the requirements of ITU-T Recommendation J.83 [ITU-T_J.83]
contents.zh-CHS: 下游信道符合ITU-T建议J.83[ITU-T_J.83]的要求

contents.text: 2.4. CM or Cable Modem
contents.zh-CHS: 2.4. CM或电缆调制解调器

contents.text: A CM acts as a "slave" station in a DOCSIS-compliant cable data system.
contents.zh-CHS: CM充当DOCSIS兼容电缆数据系统中的“从”站。

contents.text: 2.5. CMTS or Cable Modem Termination System
contents.zh-CHS: 2.5. CMTS或电缆调制解调器终端系统

contents.text: A generic term covering a cable bridge or cable router in a head-end. A CMTS acts as the master station in a DOCSIS-compliant cable data system. It is the only station that transmits downstream, and it
contents.zh-CHS: 涵盖前端电缆桥架或电缆路由器的通用术语。CMTS充当DOCSIS兼容电缆数据系统中的主站。它是唯一一个向下游传输数据的电台，而且

contents.text: controls the scheduling of upstream transmissions by its associated CMs.
contents.zh-CHS: 通过相关CMs控制上游传输的调度。

contents.text: 2.6. Codeword
A characteristic of the Forward Error Correction scheme, used above the RF media layer.
contents.zh-CHS: 前向纠错方案的一个特征，用于射频介质层之上。

contents.text: See "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209".
contents.zh-CHS: 请参阅“电缆数据服务接口规范：射频接口规范SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209”。

contents.text: 2.7. Data Packet
contents.zh-CHS: 2.7. 数据包

contents.text: The payload portion of the MAC Packet.
contents.zh-CHS: MAC数据包的有效负载部分。

contents.text: 2.8. dBmV
contents.zh-CHS: 2.8. dBmV

contents.text: A measure of RF signal voltage amplitude, whose power level is determined by the characteristic impedance. A zero dB signal power is equivalent to 48.75 dBmV signal amplitude in a 75 Ohm system.
contents.zh-CHS: 射频信号电压幅度的一种测量方法，其功率电平由特性阻抗决定。在75欧姆系统中，零dB信号功率相当于48.75 dBmV信号振幅。

contents.text: 2.9. DOCSIS
contents.zh-CHS: 2.9. 多西丝

contents.text: "Data Over Cable Service Interface Specification". A term referring to the ITU-T J112 [ITU-T_J.112] Annex B standard for cable modem systems.
contents.zh-CHS: “有线数据服务接口规范”。指电缆调制解调器系统的ITU-T J112[ITU-T_J.112]附录B标准的术语。

contents.text: 2.9.1. DOCSIS 1.0
contents.zh-CHS: 2.9.1. DOCSIS 1.0

contents.text: Cable modem systems that are CM/CMTS compliant to requirements in [RFI1.0]. A common reference to DOCSIS 1.0 in this document is the upstream channel queuing mechanism, known as Class of Service (COS).
contents.zh-CHS: 符合[RFI1.0]要求的CM/CMT电缆调制解调器系统。本文档中对DOCSIS 1.0的一个常见引用是上行信道排队机制，称为服务类（COS）。

contents.text: 2.9.2. DOCSIS 1.1
contents.zh-CHS: 2.9.2. DOCSIS 1.1

contents.text: Cable modem systems that are CM/CMTS compliant to requirements in [ITU-T_J.112]. DOCSIS 1.1 references in this document are in part associated with the upstream and downstream Quality of Service (QOS). The term DOCSIS 1.x is used in this document to refer to both DOCSIS 1.0 and DOCSIS 1.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 符合[ITU-T_J.112]要求的CM/CMT电缆调制解调器系统。本文件中的DOCSIS 1.1参考部分与上游和下游服务质量（QOS）相关。本文件中使用的术语DOCSIS 1.x指的是DOCSIS 1.0和DOCSIS 1.1。

contents.text: 2.9.3. DOCSIS 2.0
contents.zh-CHS: 2.9.3. DOCSIS 2.0

contents.text: Cable modem systems that are CM/CMTS compliant to requirements in [ITU-T_J.122]. DOCSIS 2.0 corresponds to the second generation of radio-frequency interface specifications of DOCSIS.
contents.zh-CHS: 符合[ITU-T_J.122]要求的CM/CMT电缆调制解调器系统。DOCSIS 2.0对应于DOCSIS的第二代射频接口规范。

contents.text: 2.10. Downstream
The direction from the head-end towards the subscriber.
contents.zh-CHS: 从前端到用户的方向。

contents.text: 2.11. Euro-DOCSIS
contents.zh-CHS: 2.11. 欧式DOCSIS

contents.text: Cable modem systems CM/CMTS that conform to the European spectrum lineup and are compliant to requirements of Annex F in [ITU-T_J.122].
contents.zh-CHS: 符合欧洲频谱线并符合[ITU-T_J.122]附录F要求的CM/CMT电缆调制解调器系统。

contents.text: 2.12. Head-end
The origination point in most cable systems of the subscriber video signals. Generally also the location of the CMTS equipment.
contents.zh-CHS: 在大多数有线电视系统中，用户视频信号的起始点。通常还包括CMTS设备的位置。

contents.text: 2.13. MAC Packet
contents.zh-CHS: 2.13. MAC包

contents.text: A DOCSIS PDU.
contents.zh-CHS: DOCSIS PDU。

contents.text: 2.14. MCNS
contents.zh-CHS: 2.14. MCNS

contents.text: "Multimedia Cable Network System". Generally replaced in usage by DOCSIS.
contents.zh-CHS: “多媒体有线网络系统”。通常使用DOCSIS替代。

contents.text: 2.15. Mini-slot
In general, an interval of time that is allocated by the CMTS to a given CM for that CM to transmit in an upstream direction. See [ITU-T_J.122]
contents.zh-CHS: 通常，由cmt分配给给定CM以使该CM在上游方向上传输的时间间隔。见[ITU-T_J.122]

contents.text: 2.16. QPSK (Quadrature Phase Shift Keying)
contents.zh-CHS: 2.16. QPSK（正交相移键控）

contents.text: A particular modulation scheme on an RF medium. See [Proakis00].
contents.zh-CHS: 射频介质上的一种特殊调制方案。见[Proakis00]。

contents.text: 2.17. QAM (Quadrature Amplitude Modulation)
contents.zh-CHS: 2.17. 正交幅度调制（QAM）

contents.text: A particular modulation scheme on RF medium. Usually expressed with a number indicating the size of the modulation constellation (e.g., 16 QAM). See [Proakis00].
contents.zh-CHS: 射频介质上的一种特殊调制方案。通常用表示调制星座大小的数字表示（例如，16QAM）。见[Proakis00]。

contents.text: Radio Frequency.
contents.zh-CHS: 无线电频率

contents.text: 2.19. Symbol-times
contents.zh-CHS: 2.19. 符号时间

contents.text: A characteristic of the RF modulation scheme. See [ITU-T_J.122].
contents.zh-CHS: 射频调制方案的一个特点。见[ITU-T_J.122]。

contents.text: 2.20. Upstream
The direction from the subscriber towards the head-end.
contents.zh-CHS: 从用户到前端的方向。

contents.text: 3. Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 概述

contents.text: This MIB module provides a set of objects required for the management of DOCSIS-compliant Cable Modem (CM) and Cable Modem Termination System (CMTS) RF interfaces. The specification is derived in part from the parameters and protocols described in [ITU-T_J.122].
contents.zh-CHS: 该MIB模块提供了一组管理DOCSIS兼容电缆调制解调器（CM）和电缆调制解调器终端系统（CMTS）射频接口所需的对象。本规范部分源自[ITU-T_J.122]中描述的参数和协议。

contents.text: In this document, the key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" are to be interpreted as described in [RFC2119].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中的关键词“必须”、“不得”、“要求”、“应”、“不应”、“应”、“不应”、“建议”、“可”和“可选”应按照[RFC2119]中的说明进行解释。

contents.text: 3.1. Textual Conventions
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1. 文字约定

contents.text: This MIB module defines new textual conventions for CM and CMTS indications of DOCSIS 2.0 RFI capabilities, configuration, usage, and backward compatible modes of operation, as defined in [RFI2.0]. With the same purpose, there are some textual conventions that represent capabilities and modes of operation of [RFI1.1] that are not covered by RFC 2670, and are managed proprietarily in the DOCSIS OSSI 1.1 specification [OSSI1.1].
contents.zh-CHS: 该MIB模块定义了DOCSIS 2.0 RFI功能、配置、使用和向后兼容操作模式的CM和CMTS指示的新文本约定，如[RFI2.0]中所定义。出于同样的目的，有一些文本约定表示[RFI1.1]的功能和操作模式，RFC 2670未涵盖这些功能和模式，并在DOCSIS OSSI 1.1规范[OSSI1.1]中进行了适当管理。

contents.text: 3.1.1. Textual Conventions in RFC 2670
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.1. RFC2670中的文本约定

contents.text: RFC 2670 defined two textual conventions, TenthdBmV and TenthdB, which are power measurement representations.
contents.zh-CHS: RFC 2670定义了两种文本约定，TenthdBmV和TenthdB，它们是功率测量表示。

contents.text: 3.1.2. Textual Conventions in RFC 4546
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.2. RFC4546中的文本约定

contents.text: This MIB module defines the textual convention DocsisUpstreamType to represent the DOCSIS 1.0 [RFI1.0] and DOCSIS 2.0 [RFI2.0] upstream burst modulation profiles types.
contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB模块定义文本约定DOCSIS上游类型，以表示DOCSIS 1.0[RFI1.0]和DOCSIS 2.0[RFI2.0]上游突发调制配置文件类型。

contents.text: This MIB module defines the textual conventions DocsisVersion and DocsisQosVersion to represent the DOCSIS 1.0 [RFI1.0] and DOCSIS 1.1 [RFI1.1] COS/QOS capabilities and modes of operation.
contents.zh-CHS: 该MIB模块定义了文本约定DocsisVersion和DocsisQosVersion，以表示DOCSIS 1.0[RFI1.0]和DOCSIS 1.1[RFI1.1]COS/QOS功能和操作模式。

contents.text: 3.2. Structure of the MIB
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2. MIB的结构

contents.text: This MIB module is structured as three groups:
contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB模块分为三组：

contents.text: o Management information pertinent to both Cable Modem (CM) and Cable Modem Termination System (CMTS) (docsIfBaseObjects).
contents.zh-CHS: o 与电缆调制解调器（CM）和电缆调制解调器终端系统（CMTS）（docsIfBaseObjects）相关的管理信息。

contents.text: o Management information pertinent to Cable Modem only (docsIfCmObjects).
contents.zh-CHS: o 仅与电缆调制解调器相关的管理信息（docsIfCmObjects）。

contents.text: o Management information pertinent to Cable Modem Termination System only (docsIfCmtsObjects).
contents.zh-CHS: o 仅与电缆调制解调器终端系统相关的管理信息（docsIfCmtsObjects）。

contents.text: Tables within each of these groups cover different functions; e.g., upstream queue services, channel characteristics, MAC layer management, etc. Rows created automatically (e.g., by the device according to the hardware configuration) may and generally will have a mixture of configuration and status objects within them. Rows that are meant to be created by the management station are generally restricted to configuration (read-create) objects.
contents.zh-CHS: 每个组内的表格涵盖不同的功能；e、 例如，上游队列服务、信道特征、MAC层管理等。自动创建的行（例如，由设备根据硬件配置创建的行）可以并且通常将在其中混合配置和状态对象。要由管理站创建的行通常仅限于配置（读创建）对象。

contents.text: 3.2.1. docsIfBaseObjects
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.1. docsIfBaseObjects

contents.text: docsIfDownstreamChannelTable - This table describes the existing downstream channels for a CMTS and the received downstream channel for a CM.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfDownstreamChannelTable-此表描述了CMT的现有下游信道和CM的接收下游信道。

contents.text: docsIfUpstreamChannelTable - This table describes the existing upstream channels for a CMTS and the current upstream transmission channel for a CM.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpstreamChannelTable-此表描述了CMT的现有上游信道和CM的当前上游传输信道。

contents.text: docsIfQosProfileTable - This table describes the valid Quality of Service profiles for the cable data system.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfQosProfileTable-此表描述了电缆数据系统的有效服务质量配置文件。

contents.text: docsIfSignalQualityTable - This table is used to monitor RF signal quality characteristics of received signals.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfSignalQualityTable-此表用于监测接收信号的射频信号质量特性。

contents.text: docsIfDocsisBaseCapability - This object is used to indicate the highest level of DOCSIS version a cable device can support.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfDocsisBaseCapability-此对象用于指示电缆设备可以支持的DOCSIS版本的最高级别。

contents.text: 3.2.2. docsIfCmObjects
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.2. docsIfCmObjects

contents.text: docsIfCmMacTable - This table is used to monitor the DOCSIS MAC interface and can be considered an extension to the ifEntry.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmMacTable-此表用于监控DOCSIS MAC接口，可被视为ifEntry的扩展。

contents.text: docsIfCmStatusTable - This table maintains a number of status objects and counters for cable modems. There is a comparable table at the CMTS, docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable, which maintains similar counters from the CMTS point of view.
contents.zh-CHS: DOCSIFCMSTATUSSTABLE-此表维护电缆调制解调器的许多状态对象和计数器。CMTS上有一个可比较的表docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable，它从CMTS的角度维护类似的计数器。

contents.text: docsIfCmServiceTable - This table describes the upstream service queues available at this CM. There is a comparable table at the CMTS, docsIfCmtsServiceEntry, which describes the service queues from the point of view of the CMTS.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmServiceTable-此表描述了此CM中可用的上游服务队列。CMTS上有一个可比较的表docsIfCmtsServiceEntry，它从CMTS的角度描述了服务队列。

contents.text: 3.2.3. docsIfCmtsObjects
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.3. docsIfCmtsObjects

contents.text: docsIfCmtsMacTable - Describes the attributes of each CMTS MAC interface.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsMacTable-描述每个CMTS MAC接口的属性。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsStatusTable - This table provides a set of aggregated counters that roll-up values and events that occur on the underlying sub-interfaces.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsStatusTable-此表提供一组聚合计数器，用于汇总基础子接口上发生的值和事件。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable - This table is used to hold information about known (i.e., ranging, registered, and/or previously online) cable modems on the system serviced by this CMTS.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable-此表用于保存有关此CMTS所服务系统上已知（即测距、注册和/或以前在线）电缆调制解调器的信息。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsServiceTable - This table provides access to the information related to upstream service queues.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsServiceTable-此表提供对上游服务队列相关信息的访问。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsModulationTable - This table allows control over the modulation profiles for RF channels associated with this CMTS.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsModulationTable-此表允许控制与此CMT相关的RF通道的调制配置文件。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsMacToCmTable - This table allows fast access into the docsIfCmtsCmTable via a MAC address (of the CM) interface.
contents.zh-CHS: DOCSIFCMTSMACTOMTABLE-此表允许通过（CM）接口的MAC地址快速访问DOCSIFCMTSMTABLE。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationTable - This table provides statistical load usage data for attached upstream and downstream physical channels.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationTable-此表提供连接的上游和下游物理信道的统计负载使用数据。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsDownChannelCounterTable - This table provides statistical data for attached downstream channels, appropriate as input for load usage calculations.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsDownChannelCounterTable-此表提供连接的下游通道的统计数据，适合作为负荷使用计算的输入。

contents.text: docsIfCmtsUpChannelCounterTable - This table provides statistical data for attached upstream channels, appropriate as input for load usage calculations.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsUpChannelCounterTable-此表提供连接的上游通道的统计数据，适用于负载使用计算的输入。

contents.text: 3.2.4. Relationship to the Interfaces MIB Module
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.4. 与接口MIB模块的关系

contents.text: This section clarifies the relationship of this MIB module to the Interfaces MIB [RFC2863]. Several areas of correlation are addressed in the following subsections. The implementer is referred to the Interfaces MIB document in order to understand the general intent of these areas.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节阐明了该MIB模块与接口MIB[RFC2863]的关系。以下小节介绍了几个相关领域。实施者参考接口MIB文档，以了解这些领域的总体意图。

contents.text: 3.2.4.1. Layering Model
An instance of ifEntry exists for each RF downstream interface, for each RF upstream interface, for each upstream logical Channel, and for each RF MAC layer.
contents.zh-CHS: 每个RF下游接口、每个RF上游接口、每个上游逻辑信道和每个RF MAC层都有一个ifEntry实例。

contents.text: The ifStackTable [RFC2863] MUST be implemented to identify the relationships among sub-interfaces.
contents.zh-CHS: 必须实现ifStackTable[RFC2863]以识别子接口之间的关系。

contents.text: The following example illustrates a CMTS MAC interface with one downstream and two upstream interfaces.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下示例说明了具有一个下游接口和两个上游接口的CMTS MAC接口。

contents.text: Figure 1
contents.zh-CHS: 图1

contents.text: As can be seen from this example, the RF MAC interface is layered on top of the downstream and upstream interfaces, and the RF upstream interface is layered on top of an upstream logical channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 从该示例可以看出，RF MAC接口分层在下游和上游接口之上，RF上游接口分层在上游逻辑信道之上。

contents.text: In this example, the assignment of index values could be as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 在此示例中，索引值的分配可以如下所示：

contents.text: ifIndex ifType Description
contents.zh-CHS: ifIndex ifType描述

contents.text: 2 docsCableMaclayer(127) CATV MAC Layer 3 docsCableDownstream(128) CATV Downstream interface 4 docsCableUpstream(129) CATV Upstream interface 5 docsCableUpstream(129) CATV Upstream interface 6 docsCableUpstreamChannel(205) CATV Upstream Channel 7 docsCableUpstreamChannel(205) CATV Upstream Channel 8 docsCableUpstreamChannel(205) CATV Upstream Channel 9 docsCableUpstreamChannel(205) CATV Upstream Channel
contents.zh-CHS: 2 docsCableMaclayer（127）有线电视MAC层3 docscablemownstream（128）有线电视下行接口4 docsCableUpstream（129）有线电视上行接口5 docsCableUpstream（129）有线电视上行接口6 docsCableUpstream通道205有线电视上行通道7 docsCableUpstream通道205有线电视上行通道8 docsCableUpstream通道205有线电视上游频道9文件流频道（205）有线电视上游频道

contents.text: Figure 2
contents.zh-CHS: 图2

contents.text: The corresponding ifStack entries would then be:
contents.zh-CHS: 相应的ifStack条目将是：

contents.text: Figure 3
contents.zh-CHS: 图3

contents.text: The same interface model can also be used in Telephony or Telco Return systems. A pure Telco Return system (Cable Modem, as well as Cable Modem Termination System) would not have upstream cable channels, only downstream cable channels. Systems supporting both Telco Return and cable upstream channels can use the above model without modification.
contents.zh-CHS: 同样的接口模型也可用于电话或电信返回系统。纯电信返回系统（电缆调制解调器以及电缆调制解调器终端系统）没有上游电缆通道，只有下游电缆通道。支持电信公司回线和电缆上行信道的系统可以使用上述模型，无需修改。

contents.text: Telco Return upstream channel(s) management is outside the scope of this document.
contents.zh-CHS: 电信公司退货上游渠道管理不在本文件范围内。

contents.text: 3.2.4.2. Virtual Circuits
This medium does not support virtual circuits, and this area is not applicable to this MIB module.
contents.zh-CHS: 此介质不支持虚拟电路，此区域不适用于此MIB模块。

contents.text: 3.2.4.3. ifTestTable
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.4.3. IFtestable

contents.text: The ifTestTable is optional for DOCSIS CM/CMTS implementations, but is not specifically influenced by the RF MIB.
contents.zh-CHS: ifTestTable对于DOCSIS CM/CMTS实现是可选的，但不受RF MIB的具体影响。

contents.text: 3.2.4.4. ifRcvAddressTable
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.4.4. ifRcvAddressTable

contents.text: The ifRcvAddressTable is optional for DOCSIS CM/CMTS implementations, but is not specifically influenced by the RF MIB.
contents.zh-CHS: ifRcvAddressTable对于DOCSIS CM/CMTS实现是可选的，但不受RF MIB的具体影响。

contents.text: 3.2.4.5. ifEntry
This section documents only the differences from the requirements specified in the Interfaces MIB module. See that MIB module for columns omitted from the descriptions below.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节仅记录与接口MIB模块中规定的要求之间的差异。请参阅MIB模块，了解下面描述中省略的列。

contents.text: 3.2.4.5.1. ifEntry for Downstream Interfaces
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.4.5.1. 下游接口的输入

contents.text: The ifEntry for downstream interfaces supports the ifGeneralInformationGroup and the ifPacketGroup of the Interfaces MIB module. This is an output-only interface at the CMTS, and all input status counters -- ifIn* -- will return zero. This is an input-only interface at the CM, and all output status counters -- ifOut* -- will return zero.
contents.zh-CHS: 下游接口的ifEntry支持接口MIB模块的IFGeneralInformation组和ifPacketGroup。这是CMTS上的仅输出接口，所有输入状态计数器ifIn*将返回零。这是CM上的一个仅输入接口，所有输出状态计数器ifOut*将返回零。

contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.4.5.1.1. 电缆调制解调器终端系统中下游接口的ifEntry

contents.text: 3.2.4.5.2. ifEntry for Upstream Interfaces
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.4.5.2. 上游接口的输入

contents.text: Each supported interface of the type docsCableUpstream(129) must have a corresponding ifEntry. The ifEntry for upstream interfaces supports the ifGeneralInformationGroup and the ifPacketGroup of the Interfaces MIB. This is an input-only interface at the CMTS, and all output status counters -- ifOut* -- will return zero. This is an output only interface at the CM, and all input status counters -- ifIn* -- will return zero.
contents.zh-CHS: docsCableUpstream（129）类型的每个受支持接口必须具有相应的ifEntry。上游接口的ifEntry支持接口MIB的IFGeneralInformation组和ifPacketGroup。这是CMTS上的一个仅输入接口，所有输出状态计数器ifOut*将返回零。这是CM上的仅输出接口，所有输入状态计数器ifIn*将返回零。

contents.text: 3.2.4.5.2.1. ifEntry for Upstream Interfaces in Cable Modem Termination System
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.4.5.2.1. 电缆调制解调器终端系统中上游接口的ifEntry

contents.text:
ifTable           Comments
==============    ===========================================
ifIndex           Each RF Cable Upstream interface is represented
                  by an ifEntry.
ifType The IANA value of docsCableUpstream (129).
contents.zh-CHS: 如果键入docsCableUpstream（129）的IANA值。

contents.text: ifSpeed Return the maximum channel throughput (not payload throughput) supported by the interface. The maximum throughput is calculated for the case where upstream channels are configured to maximize interface throughput.
contents.zh-CHS: ifSpeed返回接口支持的最大信道吞吐量（非有效负载吞吐量）。最大吞吐量是针对上游信道配置为最大化接口吞吐量的情况计算的。

contents.text: ifHighSpeed Return the maximum channel throughput (not payload throughput) supported by the interface. The maximum throughput is calculated for the case where upstream channels are configured to maximize interface throughput. Units for this object are (1/1 000 000) * IfSpeed.
contents.zh-CHS: ifHighSpeed返回接口支持的最大信道吞吐量（非有效负载吞吐量）。最大吞吐量是针对上游信道配置为最大化接口吞吐量的情况计算的。此对象的单位为（1/1000）*IfSpeed。

contents.text: ifPhysAddress Return the zero-length OCTET STRING.
contents.zh-CHS: ifphysadress返回长度为零的八位字节字符串。

contents.text: ifAdminStatus The administrative status of this interface.
contents.zh-CHS: ifAdminStatus此接口的管理状态。

contents.text: ifOperStatus The current operational status of this interface. This reflects the total status of all the channels under this interface. So if at least one channel has a physical connection this interface has connection.
contents.zh-CHS: ifOperStatus此接口的当前操作状态。这反映了此接口下所有通道的总状态。因此，如果至少有一个通道具有物理连接，则此接口具有物理连接。

contents.text: ifMtu The size of the largest frame that can be transmitted on this interface, specified in octets. The value includes the length of the MAC header. This is the maximum of all the ifMtu of all the channels under this interface.
contents.zh-CHS: ifMtu可在此接口上传输的最大帧的大小，以八位字节为单位。该值包括MAC头的长度。这是此接口下所有通道的所有ifMtu的最大值。

contents.text: ifInOctets ifHCInOctets The total (sum) number of octets received on all the upstream channels under this interface. This includes data packets as well as MAC packets, and includes the length of the MAC header.
contents.zh-CHS: ifInOctets ifHCInOctets此接口下所有上行通道上接收的八位字节总数（总和）。这包括数据包以及MAC包，并且包括MAC报头的长度。

contents.text: ifInUcastPkts ifHCInUcastPkts The total number of unicast packets received on all the upstream channels under this interface. This includes data packets as well as MAC packets.
contents.zh-CHS: ifInUcastPkts ifHCInUcastPkts此接口下所有上行通道上接收的单播数据包总数。这包括数据包和MAC包。

contents.text: ifInMulticastPkts ifHCInMulticastPkts Return the total number of multicast packets received on all the upstream channels under this interface. This includes data packets as well as MAC layer packets.
contents.zh-CHS: ifInMulticastPkts ifHCInMulticastPkts返回此接口下所有上行通道上接收的多播数据包总数。这包括数据包以及MAC层包。

contents.text: ifInBroadcastPkts ifHCInBroadcastPkts Return the total number of broadcast packets received on all the upstream channels under this interface. This includes data packets as well as MAC packets.
contents.zh-CHS: ifInBroadcastPkts ifHCInBroadcastPkts返回此接口下所有上行通道上接收的广播数据包总数。这包括数据包和MAC包。

contents.text: ifInDiscards The total number of received packets that have been discarded on all the upstream channels under this interface. The possible reasons are: buffer shortage.
contents.zh-CHS: i指示在此接口下所有上行通道上丢弃的接收数据包总数。可能的原因是：缓冲区不足。

contents.text: ifInErrors The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to higher layers. Possible reasons are: MAC FCS error.
contents.zh-CHS: ifInErrors包含错误的入站数据包的总数，这些错误会阻止数据包传递到更高的层。可能的原因有：MAC FCS错误。

contents.text: ifInUnknownProtos The total number of frames with an unknown packet type. These are MAC frames with an unknown packet type.
contents.zh-CHS: ifInUnknownProtos具有未知数据包类型的帧总数。这些是具有未知数据包类型的MAC帧。

contents.text: ifOutOctets Return zero. ifHCOutOctets
contents.zh-CHS: ifOutOctets返回零。ifHCOutOctets

contents.text: ifOutUcastPkts Return zero. ifHCOutOctets
contents.zh-CHS: IFOUTUCASTPKT返回零。ifHCOutOctets

contents.text: ifOutMulticastPkts ifHCOutMulticastPkts Return zero.
contents.zh-CHS: ifOutMulticastPkts ifHCOutMulticastPkts返回零。

contents.text: ifOutBroadcastPkts ifHCOutBroadcastPkts Return zero.
contents.zh-CHS: ifOutBroadcastPkts ifHCOutBroadcastPkts返回零。

contents.text: ifOutDiscards Return zero.
contents.zh-CHS: ifOutDiscards返回零。

contents.text: ifOutErrors Return zero.
contents.zh-CHS: ifouterror返回零。

contents.text: 3.2.5. Offline Upstream Parameters Handling
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.5. 离线上游参数处理

contents.text: 3.2.5.1. Overview

This section describes the offline configuration of the DOCSIS 2.0 upstream logical interface parameters. The purpose of this feature is to guarantee that upstream logical interface parameters (such as modulation profile, channel type, mini-slot size, and SCDMA attributes) are consistent prior to committing changes to an active upstream logical interface. This mechanism can reduce possible downtime of the upstream interface by minimizing SNMP SET operations to in-service upstream interfaces. This mechanism is supported by CMTSs and is not applicable to CMs.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节介绍DOCSIS 2.0上游逻辑接口参数的脱机配置。此功能的目的是确保上游逻辑接口参数（如调制配置文件、信道类型、迷你插槽大小和SCDMA属性）在提交对活动上游逻辑接口的更改之前保持一致。此机制可以通过最小化对在用上游接口的SNMP集操作来减少上游接口可能出现的停机时间。此机制受CMTSs支持，不适用于CMs。

contents.text: 3.2.5.2. Operation
This mechanism uses three upstream channel MIB objects defined for DOCSIS 2.0 CMTS implementations:
contents.zh-CHS: 此机制使用为DOCSIS 2.0 CMTS实现定义的三个上游通道MIB对象：

contents.text: docsIfUpChannelStatus - The RowStatus object for the creation of temporary interfaces in the upstream interface table. A temporary entry is used to modify, validate, and commit upstream parameters of a physical interface. In the CMTS, a physical upstream interface refers to an upstream logical channel interface.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpChannelStatus—用于在上游接口表中创建临时接口的RowStatus对象。临时条目用于修改、验证和提交物理接口的上游参数。在CMTS中，物理上行接口指的是上行逻辑信道接口。

contents.text: docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom - This MIB object associates a physical interface with a temporary interface for the purpose of updating the upstream parameters of the physical interface.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom-此MIB对象将物理接口与临时接口相关联，以更新物理接口的上游参数。

contents.text: docsIfUpChannelUpdate - This MIB object is the commit object that transfers the validated upstream parameters from the temporary interface to the physical interface.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpChannelUpdate-此MIB对象是提交对象，用于将已验证的上游参数从临时接口传输到物理接口。

contents.text: The offline upstream parameters handling operation is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 离线上游参数处理操作如下：

contents.text: o A temporary interface is created in which docsIfUpChannelStatus is set to 'createAndWait', which turns the new create entry status to 'notReady'.
contents.zh-CHS: o 创建了一个临时接口，其中docsIfUpChannelStatus设置为“createAndWait”，这会将新的创建条目状态变为“notReady”。

contents.text: o A SET to docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom in the temporary interface to the physical interface ifIndex value performs two actions:
contents.zh-CHS: o 将临时接口中的docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom设置为物理接口ifIndex值将执行两个操作：

contents.text: * Creates the association of the physical interface to the temporary interface.
contents.zh-CHS: * 创建物理接口与临时接口的关联。

contents.text: * Copies the original upstream parameters from the physical interface to the temporary interface, which turns its status to 'notInService'.
contents.zh-CHS: * 将原始上游参数从物理接口复制到临时接口，从而将其状态变为“notInService”。

contents.text: o The operator modifies the temporary interface parameters to the desired values.
contents.zh-CHS: o 操作员将临时接口参数修改为所需值。

contents.text: o At this point, a SET to 'active' to the RowStatus of the temporary interface is successful if all parameters in the temporary interface are valid for the associated physical interface; otherwise, the temporary entry remains with status 'notInservice', and the SET returns the error 'commitFailed'.
contents.zh-CHS: o 此时，如果临时接口中的所有参数对关联的物理接口有效，则将临时接口的RowStatus设置为“active”是成功的；否则，临时条目的状态仍为“notInservice”，集合返回错误“commitFailed”。

contents.text: o When the temporary interface status is 'active', a SET to docsIfUpChannelUpdate to 'true' transfers the temporary interface parameters values to the physical interface.
contents.zh-CHS: o 当临时接口状态为“活动”时，将docsIfUpChannelUpdate设置为“真”将临时接口参数值传输到物理接口。

contents.text: o After completion of the update operations, the temporary interface is destroyed, setting the docsIfUpChannelStatus to 'destroy'.
contents.zh-CHS: o 更新操作完成后，临时接口将被销毁，并将docsIfUpChannelStatus设置为“销毁”。

contents.text: 3.2.5.3. Relation of docsIfUpChannelStatus and ifMib
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.5.3. docsIfUpChannelStatus与ifMib的关系

contents.text: The main purpose of docsIfUpChannelStatus is the creation of temporary interfaces for offline handling of the configuration of physical interfaces; it does not manage the creation or control of physical interfaces. To maintain a consistent operation and status report of interfaces, this object does not manage the administrative and operational status of physical interfaces.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpChannelStatus的主要目的是创建临时接口，用于离线处理物理接口的配置；它不管理物理接口的创建或控制。为了维护接口的一致操作和状态报告，此对象不管理物理接口的管理和操作状态。

contents.text: REVISION "200605240000Z" DESCRIPTION "Revision of the IETF RF MIB module for DOCSIS 2.0. This version published as RFC 4546. This MIB module revision includes the following among others: Usage of ifType (205) for upstream logical channels. Addition of downstream and upstream utilization counters. Additional statistics per upstream interface. Upstream channel offline configuration mechanism. Added MIB support for new DOCSIS 2.0 modulation attributes. Euro-DOCSIS downstream interleave values. Adjustments to RFC 2670 definitions based on the MIB review guidelines from the IETF

contents.text:
TenthdBmV ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION
     DISPLAY-HINT "d-1"
     STATUS       current
     DESCRIPTION
         "This data type represents power levels that are normally
          expressed in dBmV.  Units are in tenths of a dBmV;
          for example, 5.1 dBmV will be represented as 51."
     SYNTAX       Integer32

TenthdB ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION
     DISPLAY-HINT "d-1"
     STATUS       current
     DESCRIPTION
         "This data type represents power levels that are normally
          expressed in dB.  Units are in tenths of a dB;
          for example, 5.1 dB will be represented as 51."
     SYNTAX       Integer32

DocsisVersion ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION
    STATUS          current
    DESCRIPTION
        "Indicates the DOCSIS Radio Frequency specification being
         referenced.
         'docsis10' indicates DOCSIS 1.0.
         'docsis11' indicates DOCSIS 1.1.
         'docsis20' indicates DOCSIS 2.0."
    SYNTAX        INTEGER {
         docsis10 (1),
         docsis11 (2),
         docsis20 (3)
    }
DocsisQosVersion ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION

STATUS          current
DESCRIPTION
    "Indicates the referenced quality-of-service
     level.
     'docsis10 refers to DOCSIS 1.0 Class of
     Service queuing services, and 'docsis11' refers
     to DOCSIS 1.1 Quality of Service."
SYNTAX        INTEGER {
    docsis10 (1),
    docsis11 (2)
}

DocsisUpstreamType ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION
    STATUS          current
    DESCRIPTION
         "Indicates the DOCSIS Upstream Channel Type.
          'unknown' means information not available.
          'tdma' is related to TDMA, Time Division
          Multiple Access; 'atdma' is related to A-TDMA,
          Advanced Time Division Multiple Access,
          'scdma' is related to S-CDMA, Synchronous
          Code Division Multiple Access.
          'tdmaAndAtdma is related to simultaneous support of
          TDMA and A-TDMA modes."
    SYNTAX          INTEGER {
        unknown(0),
        tdma(1),
        atdma(2),
        scdma(3),
        tdmaAndAtdma(4)
    }

DocsEqualizerData ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION
     STATUS       current
     DESCRIPTION
         "This data type represents the equalizer data
          as measured at the receiver interface.
          The format of the equalizer follows the structure of the
          Transmit Equalization Adjust RNG-RSP TLV of DOCSIS RFI
          v2.0 :
          1 byte Main tap location 1..(n + m)
          1 byte Number of forward taps per symbol
          1 byte Number of forward taps: n
          1 byte Number of reverse taps: m
Following are the equalizer coefficients: First, forward taps coefficients: 2 bytes F1 (real), 2 bytes F1 (imag)
contents.zh-CHS: 以下是均衡器系数：首先，前向抽头系数：2字节F1（实数），2字节F1（imag）

contents.text: ... 2 bytes Fn (real), 2 bytes Fn (imag)
contents.zh-CHS: ... 2字节Fn（实），2字节Fn（imag）

contents.text: Then, reverse taps coefficients: 2 bytes D1 (real), 2 bytes D1 (imag) ...
contents.zh-CHS: 然后，反向抽头系数：2字节D1（实），2字节D1（imag）。。。

contents.text: 2 bytes Dm (real), 2 bytes Dm (imag)
contents.zh-CHS: 2字节Dm（实数），2字节Dm（imag）

contents.text: The equalizer coefficients are considered signed 16-bit integers in the range from -32768 (0x8000) to 32767 (0x7FFF).
contents.zh-CHS: 均衡器系数被认为是-32768（0x8000）到32767（0x7FFF）范围内的有符号16位整数。

contents.text: DOCSIS specifications require up to a maximum of 64 equalizer taps (n + m); therefore, this object size can get up 260 bytes (4 + 4x64). The minimum object size (other than zero) for a t-spaced tap with a minimum of 8 symbols will be 36 (4 + 4x8)." REFERENCE "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209, Figure 8-23." SYNTAX OCTET STRING(SIZE (0 | 36..260))
contents.zh-CHS: DOCSIS规范要求最多64个均衡器抽头（n+m）；因此，此对象大小可以达到260字节（4+4x64）。具有至少8个符号的t间隔抽头的最小对象尺寸（除零外）为36（4+4x8）。“参考”电缆服务接口规范数据：射频接口规范SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209，图8-23。“语法八位字符串（尺寸（0 | 36..260））

contents.text: For DOCSIS 2.0 CMTSs, two classes of interfaces can be defined for this table: o Upstream Physical Interfaces: The traditional DOCSIS 1.x CMTS upstream interface ifType 129 and the DOCSIS 2.0 ifType 205 that are functional. In other words, interfaces that represent upstream receivers within an RF MAC interface. Entries of physical interfaces are exposed to the management interface with their corresponding ifStack hierarchy and are not administratively created by this table.
contents.zh-CHS: 对于DOCSIS 2.0 CMTS，可为此表定义两类接口：o上游物理接口：传统的DOCSIS 1.x CMTS上游接口ifType 129和DOCSIS 2.0 ifType 205，这两类接口都是功能性的。换句话说，表示RF MAC接口内的上游接收机的接口。物理接口的条目通过其相应的ifStack层次结构向管理接口公开，并且不是由该表以管理方式创建的。

contents.text: o Upstream Temporary Interfaces: A fictitious interface created for the purpose of manipulating physical interface parameters offline, then validating prior to updating the target physical interface.
contents.zh-CHS: o 上游临时接口：为脱机操作物理接口参数，然后在更新目标物理接口之前进行验证而创建的虚拟接口。

contents.text: In case of a reinitialization of the managed system, physical interfaces values persist while the temporary interfaces are not recreated.
contents.zh-CHS: 在托管系统重新初始化的情况下，物理接口值将保持不变，而临时接口不会重新创建。

docsIfUpChannelTxTimingOffset OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX Unsigned32 MAX-ACCESS read-only STATUS current DESCRIPTION "At the CM, a measure of the current round trip time obtained from the ranging offset (initial ranging offset + ranging offset adjustments). At the CMTS, the maximum of timing offset, among all the CMs that are/were present on the channel, taking into account all ( initial + periodic ) timing offset corrections that were sent for each of the CMs. Generally, these measurements are positive, but if the measurements are negative, the value of this object is zero. Used for timing of CM upstream transmissions to ensure synchronized arrivals at the CMTS. Units are one 64th fraction of 6.25 microseconds."
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpChannelTxTimingOffset对象类型语法Unsigned32 MAX-ACCESS只读状态当前描述”在CM处，从测距偏移量（初始测距偏移量+测距偏移量调整）获得的当前往返时间的度量值.在CMT，信道上存在的所有CMs中的最大定时偏移量，考虑到所有（初始+周期）为每个CMs发送的定时偏移校正。通常，这些测量值为正，但如果测量值为负，则该对象的值为零。用于CM上游传输的定时，以确保CMT处的同步到达。单位为6.25微秒的64分之一。”

docsIfUpChannelUpdate OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX TruthValue MAX-ACCESS read-create STATUS current DESCRIPTION "Used to perform the copy of adjusted parameters from the temporary interface entry to the physical interface indicated by the docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom object. The transfer is initiated through an SNMP SET to 'true' of
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpChannelUpdate对象类型语法TruthValue MAX-ACCESS read create STATUS current DESCRIPTION“用于将调整后的参数从临时接口条目复制到docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom对象所指示的物理接口。通过将SNMP设置为'true'启动传输

contents.text:
this object.
     A SET to 'true' fails and returns error 'commitFailed'
     if docsIfUpChannelStatus value is 'notInService', which
     means that the interface parameters values are not
     compatible with each other or have not been validated yet.
     Reading this object always returns 'false'."

docsIfUpChannelStatus OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX RowStatus MAX-ACCESS read-create STATUS current DESCRIPTION "This object is only used for the creation of a temporary upstream row with the purpose of updating the parameters of a physical upstream channel entry.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfUpChannelStatus对象类型语法RowStatus MAX-ACCESS read create STATUS current DESCRIPTION“此对象仅用于创建临时上游行，用于更新物理上游通道条目的参数。

contents.text: The following restrictions apply to this object: 1. This object is not writable for physical interfaces. 2. Temporary interface entries are only created by a SET of this object to createandWait(5). 3. ifAdminStatus from the Interface MIB RFC 2863 is used to take a physical upstream channel offline, to be consistent with DOCSIS 1.x operation, as indicated in RFC 2670. In addition, o ifAdminStatus 'down' is reflected in this object as 'notInService'. o ifOperStatus 'down' while ifAdminStatus 'up' is reflected in this object as 'notInservice'. 4. Temporary created rows MUST be set to 'active' with the purpose of validating upstream parameter consistency prior to transferring the parameters to the physical interface.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下限制适用于此对象：1。对于物理接口，此对象不可写。2.临时接口项仅由一组此对象创建为createandWait（5）。3.接口MIB RFC 2863的ifAdminStatus用于使物理上行信道离线，以与DOCSIS 1.x操作一致，如RFC 2670所示。此外，o ifAdminStatus“down”在该对象中反映为“notInService”。o当ifAdminStatus“up”在此对象中作为“notInservice”反映时，ifOperStatus“down”为“down”。4.临时创建的行必须设置为“活动”，以便在将参数传输到物理接口之前验证上游参数的一致性。

contents.text: Below is a mandatory procedure for adjusting the values of a physical interface: 1. Create a temporary interface entry through an SNMP SET using 'createAndWait'. At this point, the RowStatus reports 'notReady'. The Manager entity uses an ifIndex value outside the operational range of the physical interfaces for the creation of a temporary interface. 2. Set the docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom object to the ifIndex value of the physical row to update. Now docsIfUpChannelStatus reports 'notInService'. 3. Change the upstream parameters to the desired values in the temporary row.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下是调整物理接口值的强制步骤：1。使用“createAndWait”通过SNMP集创建临时接口条目。此时，行状态报告为“notReady”。Manager实体使用物理接口操作范围之外的ifIndex值来创建临时接口。2.将docsIfUpChannelCloneFrom对象设置为要更新的物理行的ifIndex值。现在docsIfUpChannelStatus报告“notInService”。3.将上游参数更改为临时行中的所需值。

contents.text:
4. Validate that all parameters are consistent by setting
        docsIfUpChannelStatus to 'active'.  A failure to set the
        RowStatus to 'active' returns the error 'commitFailed',
        which means the parameters are not compatible with the
        target physical interface.
     5. With docsIfUpChannelStatus 'active', transfer the
        parameters to the target physical interface by setting
        the object docsIfUpChannelUpdate to 'true'.
     6. Delete the temporary row by setting
        docsIfUpChannelStatus to 'destroy'."
::= { docsIfUpstreamChannelEntry 18 }

docsIfUpChannelPreEqEnable OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      TruthValue
     MAX-ACCESS  read-create
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "At the CMTS, this object is used to enable or disable
          pre-equalization on the upstream channel represented by
          this table instance.  At the CM, this object is read-only
          and reflects the status of pre-equalization as represented
          in the RNG-RSP.  Pre-equalization is considered enabled at
          the CM if a RNG-RSP with pre-equalization data has been
          received at least once since the last mac
          reinitialization."
     DEFVAL {false}
     ::= { docsIfUpstreamChannelEntry 19 }

-- The CM need only maintain entries for the classes of service
-- referenced by its docsIfCmServiceTable.
--

contents.text: If implemented as read-only, entries are created based on information in REG-REQ MAC messages received from cable modems (for Cable Modem Termination System), or based on information extracted from the TFTP option file (for Cable Modem). In the Cable Modem Termination System, read-only entries are removed if no longer referenced by docsIfCmtsServiceTable.

docsIfCmMacTable OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      SEQUENCE OF DocsIfCmMacEntry
     MAX-ACCESS  not-accessible
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Describes the attributes of each CM MAC interface,
          extending the information available from ifEntry."
     ::= { docsIfCmObjects 1 }

docsIfCmMacEntry OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      DocsIfCmMacEntry
     MAX-ACCESS  not-accessible
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "An entry containing objects describing attributes of
          each MAC entry, extending the information in ifEntry.
          An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an
          ifType of docsCableMaclayer(127)."
     INDEX { ifIndex }
     ::= { docsIfCmMacTable 1 }

docsIfCmCmtsAddress OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      MacAddress
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Identifies the CMTS that is believed to control this MAC
          domain.  At the CM, this will be the source address from
          SYNC, MAP, and other MAC-layer messages.  If the CMTS is
          unknown, returns 00-00-00-00-00-00."
     REFERENCE
         "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio
          Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209,
          Section 8.2.2."
     ::= { docsIfCmMacEntry 1 }

docsIfCmCapabilities OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      BITS {
         atmCells(0),
         concatenation(1)
     }
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Identifies the capabilities of the MAC implementation
          at this interface.  Note that packet transmission is
          always supported.  Therefore, there is no specific bit
          required to explicitly indicate this capability.
          Note that BITS objects are encoded most significant bit
          first.  For example, if bit 1 is set, the value of this
          object is the octet string '40'H."
     ::= { docsIfCmMacEntry 2 }

docsIfCmRangingRespTimeout OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      TimeTicks
     MAX-ACCESS  read-write
     STATUS      obsolete
     DESCRIPTION
         "Waiting time for a Ranging Response packet.
          This object has been obsoleted and replaced by
          docsIfCmRangingTimeout to correct the typing to
          TimeInterval."
     REFERENCE
         "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio
          Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209,
          Section 9.1.6."
     DEFVAL { 20 }
     ::= { docsIfCmMacEntry 3 }

docsIfCmRangingTimeout OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      TimeInterval
     UNITS       "HundredOfSeconds"
     MAX-ACCESS  read-write
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Waiting time for a Ranging Response packet.
          This object MUST NOT persist at reinitialization
          of the managed system."
     REFERENCE
         "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio
          Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209,
          Section 9.1.6, timer T3."
     DEFVAL { 20 }
     ::= { docsIfCmMacEntry 4 }

-- CM status table.

docsIfCmStatusInvalidMaps Counter32, docsIfCmStatusInvalidUcds Counter32, docsIfCmStatusInvalidRangingResponses Counter32, docsIfCmStatusInvalidRegistrationResponses Counter32, docsIfCmStatusT1Timeouts Counter32, docsIfCmStatusT2Timeouts Counter32, docsIfCmStatusT3Timeouts Counter32, docsIfCmStatusT4Timeouts Counter32, docsIfCmStatusRangingAborteds Counter32, docsIfCmStatusDocsisOperMode DocsisQosVersion, docsIfCmStatusModulationType DocsisUpstreamType, docsIfCmStatusEqualizationData DocsEqualizerData, docsIfCmStatusUCCs Counter32, docsIfCmStatusUCCFails Counter32 }

contents.text:
docsIfCmStatusValue OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      INTEGER {
         other(1),
         notReady(2),
         notSynchronized(3),
         phySynchronized(4),
         usParametersAcquired(5),
         rangingComplete(6),
         ipComplete(7),
         todEstablished(8),
         securityEstablished(9),
         paramTransferComplete(10),
         registrationComplete(11),
         operational(12),
         accessDenied(13)
     }
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Current Cable Modem connectivity state, as specified
          in the RF Interface Specification.  Interpretations for
          state values 1-12 are clearly outlined in the SP-RFI
          reference given below.
          The state value accessDenied(13) indicates the CMTS has
          sent a Registration Aborted message to the CM.  The same
          state is reported as accessDenied(7) by the CMTS object
          docsIfCmtsCmStatusValue."
     REFERENCE
         "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio
          Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209,
          Section 11.2.
          Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications:

docsIfCmStatusCode OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      OCTET STRING (SIZE( 0 | 5 | 6 ))
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Status code for a Cable Modem as defined in the
          OSSI Specification.  The status code consists
          of a single character indicating error groups, followed
          by a two- or three-digit number indicating the status
          condition, followed by a decimal.
          An example of a returned value could be 'T101.0'.
          The zero-length OCTET STRING indicates no status code yet
          registered."
     REFERENCE
         "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications:
          Operations Support System Interface Specification
          SP-OSSIv2.0-I09-050812, Annex D."
     ::= { docsIfCmStatusEntry 2 }

docsIfCmServiceTable OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      SEQUENCE OF DocsIfCmServiceEntry
     MAX-ACCESS  not-accessible
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Describes the attributes of each upstream service queue
          on a CM."
     ::= { docsIfCmObjects 3 }

docsIfCmServiceEntry OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      DocsIfCmServiceEntry
     MAX-ACCESS  not-accessible
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Describes the attributes of an upstream bandwidth service
          queue.
          An entry in this table exists for each Service ID.
          The primary index is an ifIndex with an ifType of
          docsCableMaclayer(127)."
     INDEX { ifIndex, docsIfCmServiceId }
     ::= { docsIfCmServiceTable 1 }

DocsIfCmServiceEntry ::= SEQUENCE {
         docsIfCmServiceId               Integer32,
         docsIfCmServiceQosProfile       Integer32,
         docsIfCmServiceTxSlotsImmed     Counter32,
         docsIfCmServiceTxSlotsDed       Counter32,
         docsIfCmServiceTxRetries        Counter32,
         docsIfCmServiceTxExceededs      Counter32,
         docsIfCmServiceRqRetries        Counter32,
         docsIfCmServiceRqExceededs      Counter32,
         docsIfCmServiceExtTxSlotsImmed  Counter64,
         docsIfCmServiceExtTxSlotsDed    Counter64

docsIfCmServiceId OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      Integer32 (1..16383)
     MAX-ACCESS  not-accessible
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Identifies a service queue for upstream bandwidth.  The
          attributes of this service queue are shared between the
          CM and the CMTS.  The CMTS allocates upstream bandwidth
          to this service queue based on requests from the CM and
          on the class of service associated with this queue."
     ::= { docsIfCmServiceEntry 1 }

docsIfCmServiceQosProfile OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      Integer32 (0..16383)
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "The index in docsIfQosProfileTable describing the quality
          of service attributes associated with this particular
          service.  If no associated entry in docsIfQosProfileTable
          exists, this object returns a value of zero."
     ::= { docsIfCmServiceEntry 2 }

docsIfCmServiceTxSlotsImmed OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      Counter32
     UNITS       "mini-slots"
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "The number of upstream mini-slots that have been used to
          transmit data PDUs in immediate (contention) mode.  This
          includes only those PDUs that are presumed to have
          arrived at the head-end (i.e., those that were explicitly
          acknowledged).  It does not include retransmission attempts
          or mini-slots used by requests.
          Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
          at reinitialization of the managed system, and at other
          times as indicated by the value of
          ifCounterDiscontinuityTime for the associated ifIndex."
     REFERENCE
         "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio
          Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209,
          Section 9.4."
     ::= { docsIfCmServiceEntry 3 }

DESCRIPTION
    "The number of upstream mini-slots that have been used to
     transmit data PDUs in immediate (contention) mode.  This
     includes only those PDUs that are presumed to have
     arrived at the head-end (i.e., those that were explicitly
     acknowledged).  It does not include retransmission attempts
     or mini-slots used by requests.
     Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
     at reinitialization of the managed system, and at other
     times as indicated by the value of
     ifCounterDiscontinuityTime for the associated ifIndex."

docsIfCmtsCapabilities OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      BITS {
         atmCells(0),
         concatenation(1)
     }
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Identifies the capabilities of the CMTS MAC
          implementation at this interface.  Note that packet
          transmission is always supported.  Therefore, there
          is no specific bit required to explicitly indicate
          this capability.
          Note that BITS objects are encoded most significant bit
          first.  For example, if bit 1 is set, the value of this
          object is the octet string '40'H."

docsIfCmtsCmStatusValue OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      INTEGER {
         other(1),
         ranging(2),
         rangingAborted(3),
         rangingComplete(4),
         ipComplete(5),
         registrationComplete(6),
         accessDenied(7),
         operational(8),
         -- value 8 should not be used
         registeredBPIInitializing(9)
     }
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
         "Current cable modem connectivity state, as specified
          in the RF Interface Specification.  Returned status
          information is the CM status, as assumed by the CMTS,
          and indicates the following events:
          other(1)
             Any state other than below.
          ranging(2)
             The CMTS has received an Initial Ranging Request
             message from the CM, and the ranging process is not
             yet complete.
          rangingAborted(3)
             The CMTS has sent a Ranging Abort message to the CM.

rangingComplete(4)
        The CMTS has sent a Ranging Complete message to the CM.
     ipComplete(5)
        The CMTS has received a DHCP reply message and
        forwarded it to the CM.
     registrationComplete(6)
        The CMTS has sent a Registration Response message to
        the CM.
     accessDenied(7)
        The CMTS has sent a Registration Aborted message
        to the CM.
     operational(8)
        Value 8 is considered reserved and should not be defined
        in future revisions of this MIB module to avoid conflict
        with documented implementations that support value 8 to
        indicate operational state after completing the BPI
        initialization process.
     registeredBPIInitializing(9)
        Baseline Privacy (BPI) is enabled and the CMTS is in the
        process of completing BPI initialization.  This state
        MAY last for a significant length of time if failures
        occur during the initialization process.  After
        completion of BPI initialization, the CMTS will report
        registrationComplete(6).
     The CMTS only needs to report states it is able to
     detect."
REFERENCE
    "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Radio
     Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209,
     Section 11.2."
::= { docsIfCmtsCmStatusEntry 9 }

DESCRIPTION
    "A measure of the current round trip time for this CM.
     Used for timing of CM upstream transmissions to ensure
     synchronized arrivals at the CMTS.  Units are in terms
     of (6.25 microseconds/(64*256)).  Returns zero if the value
     is unknown.

     docsIfCmtsCmStatusTimingOffset, for channels requiring
     finer resolution."

     Frequency Interface Specification SP-RFIv2.0-I10-051209,

--
-- The following table provides upstream channel modulation profiles.
-- Entries in this table can be
-- re-used by one or more upstream channels.  An upstream channel
-- will have a modulation profile for each value of
-- docsIfModIntervalUsageCode.

     SYNTAX      SEQUENCE OF DocsIfCmtsModulationEntry
     MAX-ACCESS  not-accessible

          upstream channels."

docsIfCmtsModulationEntry OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX DocsIfCmtsModulationEntry MAX-ACCESS not-accessible STATUS current DESCRIPTION "Describes a modulation profile for an Interval Usage Code for one or more upstream channels. Entries in this table are created by the operator.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfCmtsModulationEntry对象类型语法docsIfCmtsModulationEntry MAX-ACCESS not accessible STATUS current DESCRIPTION“描述一个或多个上行通道的间隔使用代码的调制配置文件。此表中的条目由操作员创建。

contents.text: Initial default entries MAY be created at system initialization time, which could report a value of 'permanent' or 'readOnly' for docsIfCmtsModStorageType. A CMTS MAY reject the creation of additional Interval Usage Codes for a modulation profile being defined at Initialization time. No individual objects have to be specified in order to create an entry in this table.
contents.zh-CHS: 初始默认条目可以在系统初始化时创建，这可能会报告docsIfCmtsModStorageType的“permanent”或“readOnly”值。CMTS可以拒绝为初始化时定义的调制配置文件创建额外的间隔使用代码。要在此表中创建条目，无需指定单个对象。

-- The following independent object and associated table provide
-- operators with a mechanism to evaluate the load/utilization of
-- both upstream and downstream physical channels.  This information
-- may be used for capacity planning and incident analysis and may
-- be particularly helpful in provisioning of high value QOS.
--
-- Utilization is expressed as an index representing the calculated
-- percentage utilization of the upstream or downstream channel in
-- the most recent sampling interval (i.e., utilization interval).
-- Refer to the DESCRIPTION field of the
-- docsIfCmtsChannelUtUtilization object for definitions and
-- calculation details.

docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationInterval OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX Integer32 (0..86400) UNITS "seconds" MAX-ACCESS read-write STATUS current DESCRIPTION "The time interval in seconds over which the channel utilization index is calculated. All upstream/downstream channels use the same docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationInterval.

Setting a value of zero disables utilization reporting.

contents.text: Upstream Channel Utilization Index:
contents.zh-CHS: 上游航道利用指数：

contents.text: The upstream channel utilization index is expressed as a percentage of mini-slots utilized on the physical channel, regardless of burst type. For an Initial Maintenance region, the mini-slots for the complete region are considered utilized if the CMTS received an upstream burst within the region from any CM on the physical channel. For contention REQ and REQ/DATA regions, the mini-slots for a transmission opportunity within the region are considered utilized if the CMTS received an upstream burst within the opportunity from any CM on the physical channel. For all other regions, utilized mini-slots are those in which the CMTS granted bandwidth to any unicast SID on the physical channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 上游信道利用率指数表示为物理信道上利用的小时隙的百分比，而与突发类型无关。对于初始维护区域，如果cmt在该区域内从物理信道上的任何CM接收到上游突发，则认为使用了完整区域的小时隙。对于争用REQ和REQ/数据区域，如果cmt在机会内从物理信道上的任何CM接收到上游突发，则认为该区域内的传输机会的小时隙被利用。对于所有其他区域，使用的迷你时隙是指CMT将带宽授予物理信道上的任何单播SID的时隙。

contents.text: For an upstream interface that has multiple logical upstream channels enabled, the utilization index is a weighted sum of utilization indices for the logical channels. The weight for each utilization index is the percentage of upstream mini-slots allocated for the corresponding logical channel. Example: If 75% of bandwidth is allocated to the first logical channel and 25% to the second, and the utilization indices for each are 60 and 40, respectively, the
contents.zh-CHS: 对于启用了多个逻辑上行通道的上行接口，利用率指数是逻辑通道利用率指数的加权和。每个利用率指数的权重是分配给相应逻辑信道的上行小时隙的百分比。示例：如果75%的带宽分配给第一个逻辑信道，25%分配给第二个逻辑信道，并且每个信道的利用率指数分别为60和40，则

contents.text: utilization index for the upstream physical channel is (60 * 0.75) + (40 * 0.25) = 55. This figure applies to the most recent utilization interval.
contents.zh-CHS: 上游物理信道的利用率指数为（60*0.75）+（40*0.25）=55。此图适用于最近的使用间隔。

contents.text: Downstream Channel Utilization Index:
contents.zh-CHS: 下游航道利用指数：

contents.text: The downstream channel utilization index is a percentage expressing the ratio between bytes used to transmit data versus the total number of bytes transmitted in the raw bandwidth of the MPEG channel. As with the upstream utilization index, the calculated value represents the most recent utilization interval. Formula: Downstream utilization index = (100 * (data bytes / raw bytes))
contents.zh-CHS: 下行信道利用率指数是表示用于传输数据的字节与在MPEG信道的原始带宽中传输的字节总数之间的比率的百分比。与上游利用率指数一样，计算值表示最近的利用率间隔。公式：下游利用率指数=（100*（数据字节/原始字节））

contents.text:
Definitions:
     Data bytes:    Number of bytes transmitted as data in the
                    docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationInterval.
                    Identical to docsIfCmtsDownChannelCtrUsed
                    Bytes measured over the utilization
                    interval.
     Raw bandwidth: Total number of bytes available for
                    transmitting data, not including bytes
                    used for headers and other overhead.
     Raw bytes:     (raw bandwidth *
                    docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationInterval).
                    Identical to docsIfCmtsDownChannelCtrTotal
                    Bytes measured over the utilization
                    interval."
::= { docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationEntry 3 }

contents.text: OBJECT docsIfDownChannelFrequency WRITE-SYNTAX Integer32 (54000000..860000000) MIN-ACCESS read-only DESCRIPTION "Read-write in cable modem termination systems; read-only in cable modems. The values above are appropriate for a cable plant using a Sub-Split channel plan. If DOCSIS is extended to cover other types of channel plans (and frequency allocations), this object will be modified accordingly."
contents.zh-CHS: 对象docsIfDownChannelFrequency WRITE-SYNTAX Integer32（54000000..860000000）MIN-ACCESS只读说明“电缆调制解调器终端系统中的读写；电缆调制解调器中的只读。上述值适用于使用子拆分信道计划的电缆厂。如果DOCSIS扩展到涵盖其他类型的信道计划（和频率分配），将相应修改此对象。“

contents.text: OBJECT docsIfDownChannelWidth WRITE-SYNTAX Integer32 (6000000) MIN-ACCESS read-only DESCRIPTION "It is important to implement this object as read-only. In cable modems, this object is always implemented as read-only. The above value is appropriate for cable plants running under NTSC (National Television Standards Committee) standards. If DOCSIS is extended to work with other standards (e.g., European standards), this object will be modified accordingly."
contents.zh-CHS: 对象docsIfDownChannelWidth WRITE-SYNTAX Integer32（6000000）MIN-ACCESS只读说明“将此对象实现为只读非常重要。在有线调制解调器中，此对象始终实现为只读。上述值适用于在NTSC（国家电视标准委员会）下运行的有线电视设备标准。如果DOCSIS扩展到与其他标准（如欧洲标准）一起使用，则该对象将相应地修改。”

contents.text: OBJECT docsIfDownChannelFrequency WRITE-SYNTAX Integer32 (47000000..862000000) MIN-ACCESS read-only DESCRIPTION "Read-write in cable modem termination systems; read-only in cable modems. A range of 54MHz to 860MHz is appropriate for a cable plant using a North American Sub-Split channel plan. The spectrum range has been expanded to accommodate a lower edge of 47MHz and an upper edge of 862MHz for some European channel plans. If DOCSIS is extended to cover other types of channel plans (and frequency allocations), this object will be modified accordingly."
contents.zh-CHS: 对象docsIfDownChannelFrequency写入语法整数32（47000000..862000000）最小访问只读说明“读写式电缆调制解调器终端系统；电缆调制解调器中的只读。54MHz至860MHz的范围适用于使用北美分体式信道计划的电缆厂。对于一些欧洲频道计划，频谱范围已经扩大，以适应47MHz的下边缘和862MHz的上边缘。如果DOCSIS扩展到包括其他类型的频道计划（和频率分配），则此对象将相应地修改。”

contents.text: OBJECT docsIfDownChannelWidth WRITE-SYNTAX Integer32 (6000000 | 8000000) MIN-ACCESS read-only DESCRIPTION "It is important to implement this object as read-only. In cable modems, this object is always implemented as read-only. The value of 6 MHz is appropriate for cable plants running under NTSC (National Television Standards Committee) standards. The value of 8 MHz is appropriate for cable plants running under ETSI standards. For other regional standards, this object will be modified accordingly."
contents.zh-CHS: 对象docsIfDownChannelWidth WRITE-SYNTAX Integer32（6000000 | 8000000）MIN-ACCESS只读说明“将此对象实现为只读非常重要。在有线调制解调器中，此对象始终实现为只读。6 MHz的值适用于在NTSC（国家电视标准委员会）下运行的有线电视设备标准。8 MHz的值适用于按照ETSI标准运行的电缆设备。对于其他区域标准，该对象将相应修改。”

contents.text: OBJECT docsIfUpChannelScdmaActiveCodes MIN-ACCESS read-only DESCRIPTION "Read-create in cable modem termination systems; read-only in cable modems. The number of active codes when SCDMA is in use MUST range from 64 to 128 and MUST be a non-Prime value. Providing this range allows for the following features and capabilities: 1) Power management in S-CDMA spreader-on frames (with a 3 dB spread).
contents.zh-CHS: 对象docSifupChannelSCDMAAActiveCodes最小访问只读说明“读取创建电缆调制解调器终端系统；电缆调制解调器中的只读。使用SCDMA时的活动代码数必须介于64到128之间，并且必须是非素数值。提供此范围允许以下特性和能力：1）帧上S-CDMA扩展器中的功率管理（具有3 dB扩展器）。

contents.text: 2) Avoidance of code 0. 3) Flexible mini-slot sizes with and without the use of code 0."
contents.zh-CHS: 2) 避免代码0。3） 灵活的小插槽大小，使用和不使用代码0。“

contents.text: 5. Revision History
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 修订历史

contents.text: 5.1. Scope

The MIB module in this document has been developed to accommodate DOCSIS 2.0 devices and their system capabilities. The MIB module is an update to RFC 2670 [RFC2670] with the additional incorporation of DOCSIS 2.0 [RFI2.0] and Euro-DOCSIS specification requirements [EN-300-429].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档中的MIB模块是为适应DOCSIS 2.0设备及其系统功能而开发的。MIB模块是对RFC 2670[RFC2670]的更新，新增了DOCSIS 2.0[RFI2.0]和欧洲DOCSIS规范要求[EN-300-429]。

contents.text: 5.2. Extension

We have maintained the MIB objects as defined in RFC 2670 [RFC2670]. In some cases new MIB objects have been created with identical functionality but greater capacity (i.e., 32 to 64 bits). In these situations, both the original 32 bit objects and the new 64 bit objects must be implemented.
contents.zh-CHS: 我们维护了RFC 2670[RFC2670]中定义的MIB对象。在某些情况下，已创建具有相同功能但容量更大（即32到64位）的新MIB对象。在这些情况下，必须同时实现原始32位对象和新的64位对象。

contents.text: 6. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 6. 安全考虑

contents.text: This MIB module relates to a system that will provide metropolitan public internet access. As such, improper manipulation of the MIB objects represented by this MIB module may result in denial of service to a large number of end-users.
contents.zh-CHS: 该MIB模块与提供城域公共互联网接入的系统相关。因此，对该MIB模块表示的MIB对象的不当操作可能会导致大量最终用户拒绝服务。

contents.text: There are a number of management objects defined in this MIB that have a MAX-ACCESS clause of read-write or read-create. Such objects may be considered sensitive or vulnerable in some network environments. The support for SET operations in a non-secure environment without proper protection can have a negative effect on network operations.
contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB中定义了许多具有读写或读创建MAX-ACCESS子句的管理对象。在某些网络环境中，此类对象可能被视为敏感或易受攻击。在没有适当保护的非安全环境中支持SET操作可能会对网络操作产生负面影响。

contents.text: The CMTS is the controller of most of the parameters of the DOCSIS RFI Interface. Therefore, write access to the CMTS MIB objects may compromise the end-user's services.
contents.zh-CHS: CMTS是DOCSIS RFI接口大多数参数的控制器。因此，对CMTS MIB对象的写访问可能会损害最终用户的服务。

contents.text: In the CM case, the only read-write object of this MIB module is docsIfCmRangingTimeout, which if SET maliciously, may not constitute a critical factor of service degradation.
contents.zh-CHS: 在CM情况下，此MIB模块的唯一读写对象是DocsifCmRangTimeout，如果恶意设置，可能不会构成服务降级的关键因素。

contents.text: The rest of the CM-required MIB objects in this MIB module are read-only, either by definition, or by compliance statements.
contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB模块中CM所需的其他MIB对象是只读的，根据定义或符合性声明。

contents.text: The CMTS is the controller of most of the parameters of the DOCSIS RFI Interface. Below are the CMTS MIB object's vulnerabilities:
contents.zh-CHS: CMTS是DOCSIS RFI接口大多数参数的控制器。以下是CMTS MIB对象的漏洞：

contents.text: o Objects in the docsIfBasicGroupv2, if SET maliciously, could result in a denial of service. Particularly, SETs to objects in
contents.zh-CHS: o docsIfBasicGroupv2中的对象，如果恶意设置，可能会导致拒绝服务。特别是，设置为中的对象

contents.text: docsIfDownstreamChannelTable, docsIfUpstreamChannelTable, docsIfCmtsModulationTable, and docsIfQosProfileTable (the last one in conjunction with the MIB object docsIfCmtsQosProfilePermissions) can alter negatively the physical and link layer parameters of upstream and downstream channels.
contents.zh-CHS: docsIfDownstreamChannelTable、docsIfUpstreamChannelTable、docsIfCmtsModulationTable和docsIfQosProfileTable（最后一个与MIB对象docsIfCmtsQosProfilePermissions结合使用）可能会对上游和下游通道的物理和链路层参数产生负面影响。

contents.text: o The Object docsIfCmtsServiceAdminStatus of the docsIfCmtsGroupv2 group, when SET maliciously by an attacker to 'disabled' or 'destroyed', will interrupt the service of the corresponding cable modem.
contents.zh-CHS: o 当攻击者恶意将docsIfCmtsGroupv2组的对象docsIfCmtsServiceAdminStatus设置为“禁用”或“销毁”时，将中断相应电缆调制解调器的服务。

contents.text: Some of the readable objects in this MIB module (i.e., objects with a MAX-ACCESS other than not-accessible) may be considered sensitive or vulnerable in some network environments. It is thus important to control even GET and/or NOTIFY access to these objects and possibly to even encrypt the values of these objects when sending them over the network via SNMP. Below are some sensitivity considerations:
contents.zh-CHS: 在某些网络环境中，此MIB模块中的某些可读对象（即具有MAX-ACCESS而非not ACCESS的对象）可能被视为敏感或易受攻击。因此，在通过SNMP通过网络发送这些对象时，控制甚至获取和/或通知对这些对象的访问，甚至可能加密这些对象的值，这一点非常重要。以下是一些敏感性注意事项：

contents.text: o Read access to the MIB objects in tables docsIfCmStatusTable (CM), docsIfSignalQualityTable (CM/CMTS) and in CMTS tables docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable, docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationTable, docsIfCmtsDownChannelCounterTable, and docsIfCmtsUpChannelCounterTable, could reveal information about the cable modems' distribution among the upstream and downstream channels and their performance, which could be used to gain access to a different tiered service offer. The table docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable also contains the MAC and IP addresses of the cable modems, which can be used for theft of service.
contents.zh-CHS: o 对docsIfCmStatusTable（CM）、docsIfSignalQualityTable（CM/CMTS）和CMTS表DOCSIFCMTSCMStatable、docsIfCmtsChannelUtilizationTable、docsIfCmtsDownChannelCounterTable和DOCSIFCMTSUCchannelCounterTable中MIB对象的读取访问权，可以显示有关电缆调制解调器在上行和下行信道中的分布及其性能的信息，这些信息可用于访问不同的分层服务。docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable表还包含电缆调制解调器的MAC和IP地址，可用于窃取服务。

contents.text: SNMP versions prior to SNMPv3 did not include adequate security. Even if the network itself is secure (for example by using IPSec), even then, there is no control as to who on the secure network is allowed to access and GET/SET (read/change/create/delete) the objects in this MIB module.
contents.zh-CHS: SNMPv3之前的SNMP版本未包含足够的安全性。即使网络本身是安全的（例如通过使用IPSec），即使如此，也无法控制安全网络上的谁可以访问和获取/设置（读取/更改/创建/删除）此MIB模块中的对象。

contents.text: It is RECOMMENDED that implementers consider the security features as provided by the SNMPv3 framework (see [RFC3410], section 8), including full support for the SNMPv3 cryptographic mechanisms (for authentication and privacy).
contents.zh-CHS: 建议实施者考虑SNMPv3框架所提供的安全特性（参见[RCFC310]，第8节），包括对SNMPv3加密机制的完全支持（用于身份验证和隐私）。

contents.text: Further, deployment of SNMP versions prior to SNMPv3 is NOT RECOMMENDED. Instead, it is RECOMMENDED to deploy SNMPv3 and to enable cryptographic security. It is then a customer/operator responsibility to ensure that the SNMP entity giving access to an instance of this MIB module is properly configured to give access to the objects only to those principals (users) that have legitimate rights to indeed GET or SET (change/create/delete) them.
contents.zh-CHS: 此外，不建议部署SNMPv3之前的SNMP版本。相反，建议部署SNMPv3并启用加密安全性。然后，客户/运营商应负责确保授予访问此MIB模块实例权限的SNMP实体已正确配置为仅授予那些拥有确实获取或设置（更改/创建/删除）对象的合法权限的主体（用户）访问对象。

contents.text: 7. Management Interoperability of DOCSIS 1.0, 1.1, and 2.0
contents.zh-CHS: 7. DOCSIS 1.0、1.1和2.0的管理互操作性

contents.text: The MIB module contained in this document updates RFC 2670 [RFC2670], primarily to handle the management requirements of the DOCSIS RF Interface of DOCSIS 2.0 [ITU-T_J.122]. RFC 2670 contains the DOCSIS RF Interface management requirements for DOCSIS 1.0 and DOCSIS 1.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中包含的MIB模块更新了RFC 2670[RFC2670]，主要用于处理DOCSIS 2.0[ITU-T_J.122]的DOCSIS RF接口的管理要求。RFC 2670包含DOCSIS 1.0和DOCSIS 1.1的DOCSIS RF接口管理要求。

contents.text: The management requirements of Class of Service (DOCSIS 1.0) pertaining to RFC 2670 are the same as this document update and are contained in the tables docsIfQosProfileTable, docsIfCmServiceTable, and docsIfCmtsServiceTable.
contents.zh-CHS: 与RFC 2670相关的服务类别（DOCSIS 1.0）的管理要求与本文件更新相同，并包含在表docsIfQosProfileTable、docsIfCmServiceTable和docsIfCmtsServiceTable中。

contents.text: DOCSIS 1.1 and DOCSIS 2.0 Quality of Service management requirements are defined in the DOCSIS management specifications [OSSI1.1] and [OSSI2.0], respectively.
contents.zh-CHS: DOCSIS 1.1和DOCSIS 2.0服务质量管理要求分别在DOCSIS管理规范[OSSI1.1]和[OSSI2.0]中定义。
